organization.fullName: NRZ Magdeburg Median Kliniken GmbH & Co

identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of Modified Constraint-Induced Aphasia Therapy Schedule to Treat Patients Following Sub-acute Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Constraint-Induced Aphasia Therapy Following Sub-acute Stroke: A Modified Therapy Schedule

leadSponsor.name: NRZ Magdeburg Median Kliniken GmbH & Co

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to assess the feasibility of modified Constraint-Induced Aphasia Therapy (CIAT) in the early sub-acute stage and to examine the efficacy of modified CIAT versus standard treatment with the same intensity of intervention.

keywords: Rehabilitation of Speech and Language Disorders

armGroups.label: CIAT-Group
armGroups.description: Patients received a modified constraint-induced therapy schedule
interventionNames: Other: Investigate efficacy of modified ciat schedule

armGroups.label: standard treatment group
armGroups.description: patients received a standard aphasia therapy
interventionNames: Other: examine the efficacy of standard treatment versus modified ciat schedule

interventions.name: Investigate efficacy of modified ciat schedule
examine the efficacy of standard treatment versus modified ciat schedule

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change of aphasia and aphasic syndromes by Aachen Aphasia Test (AAT)
change from pretreatment in Aachen Aphasia Test at 8 weeks
change from pretreatment in Aachen Aphasia Test at 1 year

secondaryOutcomes.measure: change from pretreatment in communication activity (CAL)at 8 weeks
Change from pretreatment in communication activity (CAL)at 1 year

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* clinical diagnosis of first-ever stroke
* aphasia in sub-acute stage
* german speakers

Exclusion Criteria:

* presence of residual aphasia
* dysarthria and apraxia of speech

references.citation: Sickert A, Anders LC, Munte TF, Sailer M. Constraint-induced aphasia therapy following sub-acute stroke: a single-blind, randomised clinical trial of a modified therapy schedule. J Neurol Neurosurg Psychiatry. 2014 Jan;85(1):51-5. doi: 10.1136/jnnp-2012-304297. Epub 2013 Jul 4.
